title: False Ban
body:
So my flatmate had his account banned in the last week or so - only found out when trying to log in after a while of not playing in order to find out what his Shop specials were. I live and play with him, and I know he's not a particularly toxic player, nor does he afk or int or anything like that, and he's not had any ban warnings before now. The ban notification says his behaviour was apparently severe enough to remain banned until next February, but I know for a fact he hasn't done anything like that - nor does he boost or script, nor did he sell/purchase his account.

He also doesn't even have _access_ to his account right now (password is incorrect and password reset isn't working) so we think he might have been hacked (unless that's just part of how being banned works, neither of us have ever been banned before). He contacted Riot support and gave the requested evidence and was promptly asked to supply additional evidence - first RP purchase, first 3100, 4800, and 6300 ip champ purchased, and what he spent refund tokens on. His account is at least five years old and he's spent around $3000 in RP on it, so of course he doesn't remember any of those.

What do?

replies.body: Just do your best to answer the questions and give them as much info as possible. They're trying to establish it's definitely the owner of the account. It's not garunteed to work but it's a chance

I don't think you can really do anything.
I mean like you can't really do anything actually.
Because like the board is very strict with their answer and / or sentence, they never really take anyones opinion as they are very *up there*.

TDLR:
You can't do shit as they won't take your opinion into account.
